fields.name: Jim Jones
fields.family_background: Grew up in a poor family, had a difficult childhood.
fields.education: Attended Indiana University and Butler University.
fields.core_beliefs: Combination of Christianity, socialism, and communal living.
fields.controversies: Accusations of abuse, brainwashing, and leading a mass suicide.
fields.followers: Thousands of members at its peak, diverse in terms of race and background.
fields.impact: Over 900 people died in the Jonestown massacre, leaving a lasting impact on public perception of cults.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive media coverage, often portrayed as a dangerous cult leader.
fields.mental_health: Possible indications of paranoia and megalomania.
fields.criminal_record: No formal criminal record before Jonestown, but numerous allegations.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a manipulative and dangerous cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Influenced the way cults are viewed and studied in modern times.

fields.name: Charles Manson
fields.family_background: Born to a 16-year-old single mother; experienced a troubled and transient childhood.
fields.education: Little formal education; spent much of his youth in juvenile institutions.
fields.core_beliefs: Apocalyptic race war theory called 'Helter Skelter'.
fields.symbols: Swastika tattoo on forehead; various other symbols associated with counterculture.
fields.controversies: Responsible for orchestrating a series of brutal murders.
fields.followers: A small group of devoted followers, primarily young women.
fields.impact: The Manson Family murders shocked the nation and led to intense media scrutiny.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive and sensational; Manson became a symbol of madness and violence.
fields.mental_health: Likely suffered from various mental health issues, including narcissistic personality disorder.
fields.criminal_record: Extensive criminal record, including charges for murder, conspiracy, and theft.
fields.trials_and_sentences: Sentenced to life in prison without parole.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as one of the most infamous and dangerous cult leaders in history.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Remains a subject of fascination and study in popular culture and criminology.

fields.name: Marshall Applewhite
fields.family_background: Son of a Presbyterian minister; had a religious upbringing.
fields.education: Studied theology; taught music at various institutions.
fields.core_beliefs: Belief in extraterrestrial life; followers were to ascend to a higher plane of existence.
fields.symbols: UFO imagery; purple shrouds worn during the mass suicide.
fields.significant_events: Mass suicide in 1997, timed with the passing of Comet Hale-Bopp.
fields.impact: The mass suicide drew international attention and remains one of the most notorious in history.
fields.media_coverage: Intense media scrutiny following the mass suicide; widely seen as bizarre and tragic.
fields.mental_health: Possible delusional disorder and narcissistic personality disorder.
fields.criminal_record: No criminal record prior to the mass suicide.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a tragic figure who led his followers to their deaths.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Highlighted the dangers of cultic mind control and apocalyptic beliefs.

fields.name: Bonnie Nettles
fields.family_background: Married with four children; worked as a nurse.
fields.core_beliefs: Belief in extraterrestrial life, ascension to a higher level of existence, and strict celibacy.
fields.leadership_style: Charismatic and spiritual; shared leadership with Marshall Applewhite (Do).
fields.significant_events: Development of strict communal living and celibacy among followers; relocation of group multiple times.
fields.controversies: Accusations of brainwashing, control over followers' lives, and promoting extreme beliefs.
fields.followers: Initially around 200, reduced to 39 core members at the time of the mass suicide in 1997.
fields.impact: Influenced other UFO and apocalyptic cults; raised awareness about the dangers of cults.
fields.media_coverage: Limited during her life, extensive after the 1997 mass suicide.
fields.mental_health: No significant documented mental health issues.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a significant, though lesser-known, figure behind Heaven's Gate's ideology.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Continued influence on UFO and new age spiritual movements.

fields.name: David Koresh
fields.family_background: Born to a 14-year-old single mother; had a difficult and unstable upbringing.
fields.education: Dropped out of high school; later claimed to have memorized large sections of the Bible.
fields.founding_date: 1955 (Branch Davidians existed before Koresh but he became the leader in the 1980s)
fields.core_beliefs: Interpretations of the Bible with apocalyptic and messianic themes.
fields.symbols: Lamb, seven seals from the Book of Revelation.
fields.significant_events: 1993 Waco siege, resulting in the deaths of 76 members.
fields.controversies: Accusations of child abuse, polygamy, and illegal weapons possession.
fields.followers: Approximately 100 members at the time of the Waco siege.
fields.impact: The Waco siege highlighted issues of religious freedom and government intervention.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive coverage, particularly during and after the Waco siege.
fields.personality_traits: Charismatic, authoritative, believed he was a prophet.
fields.mental_health: Possibly delusional with a messianic complex.
fields.criminal_record: Allegations of sexual abuse and weapons charges.
fields.public_perception: Controversial figure; some see him as a victim of government overreach, others as a dangerous cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Waco remains a cautionary tale in the handling of religious groups.

fields.name: Keith Raniere
fields.family_background: Raised in a middle-class family; was considered a child prodigy.
fields.education: Studied at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute; claimed to have multiple degrees (later disputed).
fields.core_beliefs: Self-improvement through 'Executive Success Programs'; secret society within NXIVM focused on dominance and submission.
fields.significant_events: Arrest and conviction for sex trafficking, racketeering, and other charges in 2018.
fields.controversies: Accusations of brainwashing, forced labor, and running a secret sex cult.
fields.followers: Hundreds of members, including several high-profile individuals.
fields.impact: The scandal brought significant media attention and led to legal reforms regarding cults.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive, particularly following his arrest and trial.
fields.criminal_record: Convicted of multiple charges including sex trafficking and racketeering.
fields.trials_and_sentences: Sentenced to 120 years in prison in 2020.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a manipulative predator who exploited his followers.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Raised awareness about the dangers of modern cults and coercive control.

fields.name: David Berg
fields.family_background: Raised in a religious family; his mother was an evangelical minister.
fields.education: Briefly attended college but did not graduate.
fields.core_beliefs: Mix of Christianity and radical social views; promoted free love and communal living.
fields.significant_events: Widespread allegations of sexual abuse and exploitation within the cult.
fields.controversies: Accusations of child sexual abuse, exploitation, and brainwashing.
fields.followers: Thousands at its peak, spread across multiple countries.
fields.impact: Many former members have spoken out about the abuse they suffered, leading to ongoing scrutiny.
fields.media_coverage: Significant, particularly regarding allegations of abuse.
fields.criminal_record: No formal charges during his lifetime, but numerous posthumous accusations.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a highly controversial and abusive leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: The group's legacy has influenced discussions on religious abuse and child protection.

fields.name: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
fields.family_background: Born into a Jain family; had an early interest in spirituality.
fields.education: Earned a Master's degree in philosophy; worked as a philosophy professor.
fields.core_beliefs: Emphasis on meditation, free love, and communal living; later incorporated elements of Western psychotherapy.
fields.symbols: Osho's signature mala (beaded necklace); various symbols representing meditation and spiritual growth.
fields.significant_events: Establishment of Rajneeshpuram in Oregon, USA; involvement in legal battles and criminal activities.
fields.controversies: Accusations of bioterrorism, immigration fraud, and other illegal activities.
fields.followers: Thousands of followers worldwide, including many Westerners.
fields.impact: Rajneesh's teachings continue to influence new age spirituality and meditation practices.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive, especially during the Rajneeshpuram period; often depicted as a controversial guru.
fields.criminal_record: Faced charges of immigration fraud and bioterrorism; pleaded guilty to immigration fraud and was deported from the USA.
fields.trials_and_sentences: Deported from the USA after pleading guilty to immigration fraud; other charges were dropped as part of a plea deal.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a controversial spiritual leader with both devoted followers and fierce critics.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Influenced contemporary spiritual and meditation practices; his teachings are still popular globally.

fields.name: Amy Carlson
fields.family_background: Grew up in a middle-class family; worked in the hospitality industry before founding her movement.
fields.core_beliefs: Belief in Carlson as a divine being; promoted alternative healing, ascension, and New Age spirituality.
fields.symbols: Rainbow imagery, hearts, and cosmic symbols.
fields.significant_events: Discovered mummified and decorated with Christmas lights by her followers in 2021.
fields.controversies: Accusations of abuse, brainwashing, and fraudulent practices.
fields.followers: Several dozen core members with a larger online following.
fields.impact: Raised awareness about the potential dangers of online cults and New Age movements.
fields.media_coverage: Significant media attention following her death and the discovery of her mummified body.
fields.mental_health: Believed to have had substance abuse issues and possible mental health disorders.
fields.criminal_record: No known criminal record prior to her death.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a controversial and troubled figure who exploited her followers.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Highlighted the risks of New Age movements and online cults.

fields.name: School of Prophets
fields.core_beliefs: Fundamentalist Mormon beliefs; polygamy, prophecy, and apocalypticism.
fields.significant_events: Various legal issues and controversies related to polygamy and child marriage.
fields.controversies: Accusations of child marriage, abuse, and illegal polygamous practices.
fields.followers: Several hundred members, primarily in Utah and surrounding areas.
fields.impact: Continued scrutiny of fundamentalist Mormon groups and their practices.
fields.media_coverage: Moderate, often focused on legal issues and human rights abuses.
fields.criminal_record: Various leaders have faced legal issues related to polygamy and abuse.
fields.trials_and_sentences: Several leaders have been convicted on charges related to polygamy and abuse.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as controversial and often criticized for their practices.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Continued influence on fundamentalist Mormon groups and discussions about religious freedom and human rights.

fields.name: Daniel Perez
fields.core_beliefs: Claimed to be a seer with supernatural powers; manipulated followers for personal gain.
fields.significant_events: Convicted of multiple crimes including murder and sexual abuse in 2015.
fields.controversies: Accusations of manipulation, sexual abuse, and murder.
fields.followers: A small group of devoted followers.
fields.impact: Case highlighted issues of cult manipulation and abuse.
fields.media_coverage: Moderate, particularly following his trial and conviction.
fields.criminal_record: Convicted of multiple charges including murder and sexual abuse.
fields.trials_and_sentences: Sentenced to life in prison in 2015.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a dangerous and manipulative cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Raised awareness about the potential dangers of small, manipulative cults.

fields.name: Shoko Asahara
fields.family_background: Born partially blind into a large, poor family.
fields.education: Studied acupuncture and traditional Chinese medicine.
fields.core_beliefs: Mix of Buddhism, Hinduism, and apocalyptic Christianity.
fields.controversies: Responsible for multiple terrorist attacks and murders.
fields.followers: Thousands of followers at its peak.
fields.impact: The Tokyo subway attack remains one of the most infamous terrorist acts in Japanese history.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive, particularly following the subway attack.
fields.criminal_record: Convicted of multiple charges including murder and terrorism.
fields.trials_and_sentences: Sentenced to death and executed in 2018.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a dangerous and delusional terrorist leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Highlighted the dangers of extremist religious cults.

fields.name: Adolfo Constanzo
fields.family_background: Raised in a religious household; introduced to Palo Mayombe by his mother.
fields.education: Briefly attended a seminary; trained in occult practices.
fields.core_beliefs: Mix of Palo Mayombe, Santería, and drug trafficking.
fields.controversies: Involved in human sacrifice, drug trafficking, and other violent crimes.
fields.followers: A small, loyal group of followers and drug associates.
fields.impact: Exposed the violent potential of occult and criminal cults.
fields.media_coverage: Intense media coverage following the discovery of ritual murders.
fields.criminal_record: Involved in multiple murders, drug trafficking, and human sacrifice.
fields.trials_and_sentences: Died during a police raid before trial.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a violent and dangerous cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Raised awareness of the potential for violence in occult practices.

fields.name: Joseph Di Mambro
fields.core_beliefs: Mix of New Age beliefs, Templar mythology, and apocalyptic prophecy.
fields.symbols: Templar cross and other medieval symbols.
fields.controversies: Accusations of financial fraud, mind control, and murder.
fields.impact: The group's actions resulted in significant scrutiny of New Age movements.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive coverage following the mass deaths.
fields.criminal_record: Involved in financial fraud and orchestrating mass deaths.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a manipulative and dangerous cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Raised awareness of the dangers of apocalyptic cults.

fields.name: Luc Jouret
fields.education: Studied medicine in Belgium; trained as a homeopathic doctor.
fields.core_beliefs: Mix of New Age beliefs, Templar mythology, and apocalyptic prophecy.
fields.symbols: Templar cross and other medieval symbols.
fields.controversies: Accusations of financial fraud, mind control, and murder.
fields.impact: The group's actions resulted in significant scrutiny of New Age movements.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive coverage following the mass deaths.
fields.criminal_record: Involved in financial fraud and orchestrating mass deaths.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a manipulative and dangerous cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Raised awareness of the dangers of apocalyptic cults.

fields.name: Pyotr Kuznetsov
fields.education: Studied engineering; worked as an architect.
fields.core_beliefs: Believed in an imminent apocalypse; strict adherence to the Russian Orthodox tradition.
fields.significant_events: Convinced followers to live in an underground bunker awaiting the end of the world.
fields.controversies: Accusations of endangering followers by persuading them to live underground.
fields.followers: A small group of devoted followers.
fields.impact: Brought attention to apocalyptic cults in Russia.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive media coverage during the standoff with authorities in 2007.
fields.criminal_record: No significant criminal record but was forcibly hospitalized for mental health treatment.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a delusional and dangerous cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Raised awareness of the dangers of apocalyptic and isolationist cults.

fields.name: Credonia Mwerinde
fields.family_background: Details not widely known; formerly a bar owner.
fields.cult_founded: Movement for the Restoration of the Ten Commandments of God
fields.core_beliefs: Strict adherence to the Ten Commandments; apocalyptic beliefs.
fields.symbols: Religious imagery related to the Ten Commandments.
fields.significant_events: Mass murder-suicide that killed over 700 followers in 2000.
fields.controversies: Accusations of manipulation, abuse, and orchestrating mass murder.
fields.impact: One of the deadliest cult-related tragedies in history.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive media coverage following the mass deaths in 2000.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a manipulative and dangerous cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Raised awareness of the potential for extreme danger in apocalyptic cults.

fields.name: Joseph Kibweteere
fields.cult_founded: Movement for the Restoration of the Ten Commandments of God
fields.core_beliefs: Strict adherence to the Ten Commandments; apocalyptic beliefs.
fields.symbols: Religious imagery related to the Ten Commandments.
fields.significant_events: Mass murder-suicide that killed over 700 followers in 2000.
fields.controversies: Accusations of manipulation, abuse, and orchestrating mass murder.
fields.impact: One of the deadliest cult-related tragedies in history.
fields.media_coverage: Extensive media coverage following the mass deaths in 2000.
fields.public_perception: Viewed as a manipulative and dangerous cult leader.
fields.influence_on_modern_movements: Raised awareness of the potential for extreme danger in apocalyptic cults.
